name: Ring of Water Walking
notes: While wearing this ring, you cast Water Walk from it, targeting only yourself.

notes: While wearing this ring, you can take a Magic action to gain X-ray vision with a range of 30 feet for 1 minute.

notes: This black or dark-blue robe is embroidered with small white or silver stars.

notes: This elegant garment is made from exquisite cloth and adorned with runes.

notes: This robe has cloth patches of various shapes and colors covering it.

name: Rod of Absorption
notes: While holding this rod, you can take a Reaction to absorb a spell that is targeting only you and doesn’t create an area of effect.

name: Rod of Alertness
notes: This rod has the following properties.

name: Rod of Lordly Might
notes: This rod has a flanged head, and it functions as a magic Mace that grants a +3 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with it.

name: Rod of Resurrection
notes: The rod has 5 charges.

name: Rod of Rulership
notes: You can take a Magic action to present the rod and command obedience from each creature of your choice that you can see within 120 feet of yourself.

name: Rod of Security
notes: While holding this rod, you can take a Magic action to activate it.

name: Rod of the Pact Keeper
notes: While holding this rod, you gain a bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your Warlock spells.

notes: This 60-foot length of rope can hold up to 3,000 pounds.

name: Rope of Entanglement
notes: This rope is 30 feet long.

name: Rope of Mending
notes: This 50-foot coil of rope can repair itself when cut into any number of smaller pieces.

name: Ruby of the War Mage
notes: Etched with eldritch runes, this 1-inch-diameter ruby allows you to use a Simple or Martial weapon as a Spellcasting Focus for your spells.

name: Saddle of the Cavalier
notes: This saddle confers the following benefits while you are seated in it and astride a mount.

name: Scarab of Protection
notes: This beetle-shaped medallion provides three benefits while it is on your person.

name: Scimitar of Speed
notes: You gain a +2 bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Scroll of Protection
notes: Each Scroll of Protection works against creatures of a specific creature type chosen by the DM or determined by rolling on the following table.

name: Scroll of Titan Summoning
notes: When you take a Magic action to read this scroll, a particular titan named in the scroll appears in an unoccupied space on the ground or in water that you can see within 1 mile of yourself.

name: Sending Stones
notes: Sending Stones come in pairs, with each stone carved to match the other so the pairing is easily recognized.

name: Sentinel Shield
notes: While holding this Shield, you have Advantage on Initiative rolls and Wisdom (Perception) checks.

name: Shield, +1, +2, or +3
notes: While holding this Shield, you have a bonus to Armor Class determined by the Shield’s rarity, in addition to the Shield’s normal bonus to AC.

name: Shield of Expression
notes: The front of this Shield is shaped in the likeness of a face.

name: Shield of Missile Attraction
notes: While holding this Shield, you have Resistance to damage from attacks made with Ranged weapons.

name: Shield of the Cavalier
notes: While holding this Shield, you have a +2 bonus to Armor Class.

name: Silvered Weapon
notes: An alchemical process has bonded silver to this magic weapon.

name: Slippers of Spider Climbing
notes: While you wear these light shoes, you can move up, down, and across vertical surfaces and along ceilings, while leaving your hands free.

name: Smoldering Armor
notes: Wisps of harmless, odorless smoke rise from this armor while it is worn.

name: Sovereign Glue
notes: This viscous, milky-white substance can form a permanent adhesive bond between any two objects.

name: Spellguard Shield
notes: While holding this Shield, you have Advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects, and spell attack rolls have Disadvantage against you.

notes: This tankard has a stern face sculpted into one side.

notes: Whelm is a powerful weapon forged by dwarves and lost in the dungeon of White Plume Mountain.

name: Wraps of Unarmed Power
notes: While wearing these wraps, you have a bonus to attack rolls and damage rolls made with your Unarmed Strikes.

name: Boots of the Winding Path
notes: While wearing these boots, you can take a Bonus Action to teleport up to 15 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. You must have occupied that space at some point during the current turn.

name: Dazzling Weapon
notes: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. While holding it, you can take a Bonus Action to cause it to shed Bright Light in a 30-foot radius and Dim Light for an additional 30 feet. You can extinguish the light as a Bonus Action.

name: Helm of Awareness
notes: While wearing this helmet, you have Advantage on Initiative rolls.

name: Manifold Tool
notes: This tool takes the form of a wrench, a screwdriver, or another basic tool. As a Magic action, you can touch the item and transform it into a type of Artisan’s Tools of your choice. Whatever form the tool takes, you have proficiency with it when you use it.

name: Mind Sharpener
notes: The item has 4 charges. When you fail a Constitution saving throw to maintain Concentration, you can take a Reaction and expend 1 of the item’s charges to succeed instead. The item regains 1d4 expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Repeating Shot
subtype: Any Simple or Martial with the Ammunition Property
notes: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it when it’s used to make a ranged attack, and it ignores the Loading property if it has that property.

name: Repulsion Shield
notes: You gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class while wielding this shield.

name: Returning Weapon
subtype: Any Simple or Martial with the Thrown Property
notes: This magic weapon grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it, and it returns to your hand immediately after you use it to make a ranged attack roll.

name: Spell-Refueling Ring
notes: While wearing this ring, you can recover one expended spell slot as a Bonus Action. The recovered slot can be of level 3 or lower. Once used, the ring can’t be used again until the next dawn.

name: Calimemnon Crystal
notes: This immaculately cut sixty-sided diamond fits in one hand, yet it contains an entire genie empire. The Calimemnon Crystal was made by high elf magic to imprison the notorious genie lords Calim and Memnon , who once ruled and warred over what is now Calimshan .

notes: Display in VTT

name: Harper Pin
notes: When you attune to this pin, choose a Harper persona (see the Forgotten Realms: Heroes of Faerûn for examples), including an alignment and a creature type. While wearing this pin, you register as that persona when targeted by magic to determine your creature type, alignment, or location.

name: Orb of Damara
notes: A wizard named Damara created this orb while devising a way to become a dragon. name: Aether Blood
notes: The most extravagant rumors claim the creation of this glowing purple liquid requires the blood of a unicorn -- a creature generally regarded as mythical. Regardless of the truth, the potent magic in a vial of Aether Blood leads many spellcasters to carry it for use in dire circumstances.

name: Amulet of Curse Suppression
notes: This glittering amulet of ivory and silver can be used to temporarily fend off the effects of curses. While attuned to the amulet, the effects of any curses on you are nullified, as though they had been removed by the Remove Curse spell.

name: Angelskin Armor
notes: This leather armor is made from the flayed flesh of angels. While attuned to the armor, you have Resistance to Bludgeoning, Piercing, and Slashing damage. Any Celestial that sees this armor immediately becomes Hostile toward the wearer, and any Fiend wants to possess it at any cost.

name: Arcane Oil
notes: This substance is created by distilling the jelly that encases the brain of a xakalonus. You can take a Bonus Action to coat one weapon or up to 20 pieces of ammunition. notes: The blades of this axe smolder with an inner light, and the dark wooden handle is accented with silver. name: Banshee Box
notes: This ivory music box is inlaid with silver decorations depicting tiny scenes of gruesome violence. name: Blood Capsule
notes: This cylindrical flask is etched with arcane runes. Humanoid blood stored in the blood capsule remains fresh for up to one year. The flask stores enough blood to sustain a vampire for one day.

notes: This spotted grey cloak is made of styrkvisnar hide. While wearing it, you have Advantage on Strength (Athletics) checks.

notes: This coat is made from the tongues of a harvester of lies’ victims. While you wear it, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class and you have Advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks.

notes: This dark metal coin is a token of heretical dogma that claims Empyreus and Beleth are one and the same. One side bears the Empyreus's icon, while the other shows Beleth's leering face.

name: Coldrazor
notes: This infamous axe is wielded by the memori lich known as Runa Banasár. It appears to be made of ice, carved with runes and studded with various tiny, glittering gems.

name: Collar of the Undead
notes: Some people have no qualms about exploiting any opportunity for profit, including the sorrow caused by the loss of a loved one. Such people would appreciate the Collar of the Undead, whether as con artists looking for bereaved individuals to fleece, or as dark sorcerers in need of souls.

notes: This dagger is fashioned from a dragonborn vampire's fangs. When a wielder scores a Critical Hit with the dagger, the weapon damage is 4d4 instead of 2d4. name: Dreams Leaves
notes: Made from a mysterious, magically grown plant, this popular new drug induces vivid hallucinations in which the user's dreams appear to be fulfilled. Some users even see visions of branching possibilities that their life could take.

name: Ectoplasmic Whip

notes: This tendril of flesh, harvested from an Aberration, melds with the body of its host. notes: This crown is woven of aromatic flowers. When you first don the crown after attuning to it, 1d6 + 3 butterflies begin fluttering around it.

notes: This swirling mixture of red and white liquid is formed from the remains of a coldfire ooze. name: Hogs’ Wash
notes: This foul-tasting tea is brewed from the powdered tusks of doom boars. When you drink this potion, you gain the effect of a Remove Curse spell.

name: Humble Frock
notes: While wearing this frock and not wearing any armor, Opportunity Attack rolls against you have Disadvantage.

notes: This glowing green liquid sends a creature’s immune system into a hyperactive state. When you drink this potion, you have Immunity to Poison damage and to the Poisoned condition for 1 hour. name: Knifewing Cape
notes: This cloak is made from the skin of twenty knifewings. While wearing it, you gain a +1 bonus to Armor Class. If you fall, you descend 60 feet per round and take no damage from falling.

name: Light Drinker
notes: This sword’s hilt and blade are forged from a single piece of black metal that absorbs the light around it. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, which deals Cold damage instead of Slashing damage. While attuned to the sword, you gain Darkvision to 60 feet and c

name: Lindwyrm Venom
notes: This terrible venom is extracted and distilled from the deadly lindwyrm. It can be delivered via ingestion or a wound. A creature exposed to the venom must succeed on a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or take 36 (8d8) Poison damage and have the Poisoned condition for 1 minute. While Poisoned, the cr

name: Living Net
notes: This net is made of wire and thread from a suture golem. It can be used in the same manner as a normal Net, but once it restrains a target it coils and twists as if alive. Escaping the Living Net requires a DC 15 Strength (Athletics) check. The Living Net has AC 15 and 15 HP. If destroyed, the net r

name: Lodestone Armor
notes: This plate armor is lined with magnetic lodestone harvested from a different plane of existence. While wearing the armor, you can take a Bonus Action to enhance its magnetic polarity for 1 minute. Loose stones, soil, and minerals are immediately attracted to the surface of the armor, granting you a

name: Lycanthropy Antidote
notes: Made with fzeg blood, this silvery potion is dotted with swirling flecks of red. Drinking this liquid removes the curse of lycanthropy.

name: Lycan Weapon
notes: Made from the claws, teeth, and bones of lycanthropes, these weapons are particularly effective against other lycanthropes or vampires. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Magebane Bomb
notes: This bubbling liquid is distilled from the remains of a magebane ooze. You can throw the container at an enemy’s weapon or armor, or at a spellcaster.

name: Malleus Macabre
notes: This weapon is a blunt but jagged-edged bludgeon that is the object form of a kokela. You gain a +4 bonus to damage rolls made with this weapon, and attack rolls made with this weapon score a Critical Hit on a roll of 19 or 20. If you have abilities that increase your critical range with melee attac

name: Mask of the Maestro
notes: Carved from yew, this mask is shaped in the likeness of a beast’s visage and has 3 charges. While wearing the mask, you can expend 1 charge to cast Polymorph on yourself, with a maximum duration of 1 minute.

name: Morose Monocle
notes: This opaque, grey eyepiece completely blocks normal vision for the eye wearing it. The only things you can see through it are grief eaters, and creatures experiencing significant pain, sorrow, or guilt. These creatures appear as white outlines, shining with an intensity that matches their emotional

name: Mortal Coil
notes: This ring is composed of hundreds of rose gold wires woven to coil around the finger. It allows its wearer's spirit to resist the pull of the afterlife.

name: Muscle Graft
notes: Created through a gruesome process requiring the muscle tissue of a bugbear vampire, this graft melds to the flesh of a living creature who attunes to it. Your Strength increases by 2, to a maximum of 30. When you become attuned, you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution save or your Constitution dec

name: Net of Maiden’s Hair
notes: Sewn from the plant creature known as maiden’s hair, this sweet-smelling piece of headgear bestows lingering magical properties. While wearing the net on your head, you have Advantage on Charisma (Persuasion) checks. Additionally, you can take a Bonus Action to make an ability check to end the Grapp

name: Nightmare Staff
notes: This twisted staff is created from the remains of a marra. It has 3 charges and regains its expended charges daily at dusk. When a creature you can see within 60 feet of you damages you while you hold this staff, you can take a Reaction to expend 1 of the staff’s charges to force the creature to mak

name: Paragon’s Plate
notes: This ancient set of armor, which includes boots, greaves, a cuirass, gauntlets, and a helm, fully encases you in a shell of imposing steel, such that no part of your body is visible. While wearing this armor, you have Immunity to the Unconscious condition. If you have 0 Hit Points, you must still ma

name: Paralyzing Bolt
notes: These serpent tooth-tipped crossbow bolts cause a target’s muscles to become rigid. When a creature takes damage from this bolt, it has the Paralyzed condition until the end of your next turn unless they succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. Once it hits a target, the ammunition is no longer

name: Pharazorthok Sprout
notes: This hand-sized fleshy sapling has writhing tentacles for branches and bulbous yellow eyes studding its trunk. You can take a Magic action to plant it in the ground in your space, at which point it begins whispering telepathically to you. While the sprout is planted and within 30 feet of you, you ha

name: Pigskin Armor
notes: This strong, flexible armor made from the hide of ogre swine is surprisingly supple. It is considered Light armor rather than Medium armor. When a Critical Hit is scored on you, roll 1d20. On a 17-20, you treat it as a hit instead. However, while wearing the armor, you snore uncontrollably while sle

name: Potion of Glacial Resistance
notes: This brew is made from the ground horns of keppmirs. When consumed, this potion allows you to breathe underwater for 1 hour, during which time you have Resistance to Cold damage. It tastes salty and gives off a slight warmth.

name: Potion of Harm
notes: This concoction is the result of a failed attempt to make a Potion of Heal from the remains of a downcast vampire. It is indistinguishable from that potion without using divination magic of level 3 or higher.

name: Potion of Heal
notes: This ebon liquid is made from the remains of a downcast vampire. When you imbibe this potion, you regain all your Hit Points.

name: Potion of Life Sharing
notes: This shimmering liquid changes colors constantly within its vial. Made from the acid glands of the dreaded wolfentroika, this potion allows you to share your life force with others. After drinking this potion, you can take a Bonus Action to choose a creature within 30 feet of you that you can see or

name: Potion of Malice
notes: This brew is made from the spore sacs of three grippers. When consumed, this potion causes the imbiber to give off spores that anger enemies within 10 feet. Those enemies must succeed on a DC 10 Wisdom saving throw, or they must target the imbiber with their attacks for 1 minute. All weapon attacks

name: Potion of Relentlessness
notes: This viscous potion is made from quoxxarie blood. After drinking this potion, when you are reduced to 0 Hit Points you can expend a Hit Point Die (no action required) and set your Hit Points to 1. This effect lasts for 1 minute, at the end of which you must succeed on a DC 15 Constitution saving thr

name: Profane Charm
notes: This charm is a charred feather harvested from a fallen angel, wrapped in silver wire. While you wear this charm, your creature type appears to be Humanoid for the purpose of Detect Evil and Good and similar effects.

name: Quakescale Armor
notes: Fashioned from the scales of a quake drake, this armor rumbles softly with the sound of thunder during storms. While wearing it, you have Resistance to Thunder damage.

name: Queen’s Token
notes: This humble acorn is one of the mightiest gifts a Faerie queen can bestow upon her subjects. While holding the acorn, you can cast the Wish spell. After using the acorn in this way, it immediately teleports back to the queen who bestowed it.

name: Ready Gunk
notes: This sticky paste is fashioned from the powdered bone armor of a bone trader. After you treat a weapon, shield, or other item that can be wielded in one or two hands with the paste, you can take a Bonus Action to summon and equip it, as long as the item is within 30 feet of you. After using this eff

name: Resuscitation Bomb
notes: This foul-smelling concoction is made from the remains of stinking sludge. As a Magic action, you can throw the vial up to 10 feet, where it breaks and releases a noxious vapor that fills a 30-foot-radius Sphere. Each creature in the area with the Incapacitated, Stunned, or Unconscious condition end

name: Ring of Hidden Desires
notes: This rose gold band is set with an obsidian stone carved in the shape of a heart. While wearing this ring, you can use a Magic action to attempt to learn a creature’s darkest desire. Select a creature that you can see. That creature must succeed on a DC 13 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, you

name: Ring of Nightmares
notes: This ring's crafting requires powdered brain from a restless lumberer. It has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. While wearing the ring, you can take a Bonus Action to expend 1 charge to change the damage type of the next spell you cast before the end of your turn to Psychic d

name: Ring of Radiation
notes: This ring is made of braided copper wire. While wearing this ring, your elemental energies are supercharged, allowing them to radiate from your body. When you cast a spell or use an ability that does Cold, Fire, or Lightning damage, the range of the spell or ability is doubled.

name: Ring of Veracity
notes: This golden band is stamped with images of smiling humanoid faces. While attuned to this ring, the wearer has Advantage on Search actions to make a Wisdom (Insight) check.

name: Rod of Ruin
notes: This rod is formed of stacked crystal spheres filled with smoke. The rod has 3 charges and regains all expended charges daily at dusk.

name: Rod of the Pack Master
notes: This rod appears to be a piece of driftwood carved with images of wolves and bears. While holding the rod, you can take a Magic action to cast Polymorph on any number of willing Humanoids you can see within 30 feet of you. The only forms you can choose for each target are Black Bear and Wolf, and th

name: Sangromancer’s Vial
notes: This vial of red glass and gold filigree is useful to practitioners of blood magic. As part of the Attunement process, you fill the vial with your own blood. Choose up to 10 of your Hit Point Dice and roll them, reducing your Hit Point maximum by an amount equal to the result. This creates a pool of

name: Second Skin
notes: This harness is woven from the hides of slain lycanthropes. When you attune to this item, the harness melds into your flesh, making it tough. Your Armor Class is 14 + your Dexterity modifier. When you take Bludgeoning, Piercing, or Slashing damage from a source that is not silver, you can use a Reac

name: Shadowsteel Blades
notes: Crafted from the dark material known as Shadowsteel, these weapons seem to ignore most armor, instead slicing through the spiritual essence of living flesh while delivering excruciating pain to their victims. Survivors of an encounter with a Shadowsteel Blade often report lasting pain that lingers f

name: Sizzling Serum
notes: Created from the ichor in a potbelly’s stomach-pot, this volatile concoction is effective at damaging inorganic substances. As a Magic action, you can hurl the serum at a Construct or an object that you can see within 30 feet of you. The target makes a DC 15 Constitution saving throw, taking 10d6 Fi

name: Soulbond Stone
notes: This smooth and weighty stone has a dusk-colored gem embedded in its center. When pressed to the chest of a creature who has been dead for less than one minute, the stone captures a fragment of the dead creature's soul for later use.

name: Staff of Briars
notes: This wooden staff is made from the harvested claws of a braerog. It has 10 charges. While holding the staff, you can take a Magic action to expend 1 charge and cause thorn-covered rose vines to sprout up, covering a 20-foot square centered on a point within 5 feet of you. This area becomes Difficult

name: Staff of the Sorcerer King
notes: David Alunan

name: Stalk Symbiote
notes: This ocular organ, harvested from a living Aberration, melds with the skull of its host. If you are a Humanoid, you can attune to this item by stitching it into your scalp during the Attunement process. At the end of this time, the stalk burrows into your skull and bonds with your brain. Non-Humanoi

name: Star Metal Ring
notes: This heavy steel ring is set with a chunk of shimmering star metal. While wearing this ring, your appendages are crusted with iridescent star metal. Your Unarmed Strikes are considered magical and deal Force damage.

name: Straitjacket
notes: This stained grey jacket has long arms reaching the floor and contains dozens of restraining straps. This magical jacket takes 10 minutes to don or doff. While wearing this item and not wearing armor or wielding a shield, you add your Intelligence modifier to your Armor Class. Also, you can cast spe

name: Suit of the Lamb
notes: This suit of comfortable woolen clothes, made from the wool of the rare and dangerous poffer, includes a shirt, trousers or a kilt, and thick socks. While wearing the suit, you have Resistance to Lightning damage, and you don’t suffer effects from extreme cold weather.

name: Sun Shades
notes: These black leather goggles are set with cloudy glass that completely obscures the eyes of the wearer. You can take a Utilize action to don or doff these goggles. While wearing these goggles, you ignore your Sunlight Sensitivity, as well as any other ill effects you would suffer due to exposure to s

name: Talisman of Tormach
notes: The dreadful talisman is crafted from the skull at the center of a gore elemental. When you kill a creature with a Melee weapon or an Unarmed Strike while you wear the talisman, you gain 10 Temporary Hit Points for 1 minute. While you have any of these Temporary Hit Points, your melee weapon attacks

name: Telltale Heart
notes: This cherry-sized bloodstone heart is the beating center of a poppet. While the stone is on your person, when you gain the Frightened condition, you can make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw. On a success, you end the Frightened condition.

name: Thought Talker Orbs
notes: This magical spying device, designed by gnome engineers on behalf of the Ebon Syndicate, is composed of two crystal orbs. The Emitter Orb is marble-sized, making it easy to slip into your target's purse or pocket. The Receiver Orb is fist-sized.

name: Thricecall Mirror
notes: This ornate hand mirror, made of carved iron and adorned with images of grasping hands, can be used to contact other planes. As a Magic action, you can speak the true name of an extraplanar being, such as a Fey, Fiend, or Celestial, into the mirror three times. This summons the named creature in an

name: Toadstool Toddy
notes: This carbonated liquid, a potent distillation of faerie magic, is bright fuchsia and tastes of autumn rain. A Humanoid who drinks a Toadstool Toddy has Immunity to Fire and Cold damage for 1 hour.

name: Tormach’s Blessed Weapon
notes: Dedicated followers of Tormach sometimes gain the blessing of the Lord of Blood Oaths. When they do, their weapons gain a spark of the Marauder’s power. When you hit with this weapon, you can cause the target to succeed on a DC 15 Strength saving throw or have the Prone condition. Once a creature fa

name: Vilesmog Bomb
notes: This smoky concoction is a favorite of poisoners and assassins. You can use a Magic action to throw this vial up to 30 feet away from you, at which point it breaks and releases a dark vapor that fills a 15-foot-radius Sphere centered on it for 2 rounds. A creature that enters the area or starts its

name: Wand of Silence
notes: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can expend 1 charge to cast Silence from it (save DC 15). The wand regains 1d6 + 1 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the wand’s last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the wand crumbles into ashes and is destroyed.

name: Wand of the Poltergeist
notes: This wand is a swirl of dark and white wood, topped with a carved screaming skull. The wand has 7 charges.

name: Wraps of Aphaeleon
notes: Aphaeleon is the Arch Seraph of temperance and spiritual balance, a patron to many monks. While wearing these simple cloth fist wraps endowed with his blessing, you can spend 3 Focus Points on your turn to end the Incapacitated, Paralyzed, or Stunned condition on yourself (no action required).

name: Zeal
notes: This warhammer glows with an inner light. When the celestial realm nearly fell, a heavenly smith received a vision, to craft a hammer like no other. With the might of Zeal, heaven's armies turned back their foes, restoring the cosmic balance.

name: Dämglesvir
notes: Few ever saw the gleaming blade Dämglesvir before the God’s End, as only the emperor was permitted to draw the sword from its sheath. Now its blade and hilt are black, like a weapon dipped in shadow.

name: Hearthfire Breastplate
notes: Maria Trofimova

name: Indorius’s Crown
notes: Indorius’s Crown bestows authority on whoever wears it, making their reasoning seem stronger and their coercions harder to resist. The crown does not, however, provide its wearer with wisdom.

name: Ulmyr’s Eye
notes: Ulmyr’s Eye appears to be a crystal ball filled with ever-shifting smoke. Peering into the orb reveals hazy visions, many of which are disturbing.

name: Bomboozler
notes: Within this sturdy, corrosion-resistant polyhedron is a phial of ooze acid; a caustic substance with remarkable powers of biological alteration.

name: Caltrooze
notes: Michelle Mueller

name: Flooze
notes: The versatility of the magically-enhanced ooze used to craft this flail can’t be overstated. Its high tensile strength allows its ‘chain’ to stretch in response to its wearer’s thoughts, while the flail’s head boasts a hardness and density comparable to steel.

name: Goo Luck Dice
notes: Mohammed “Aggi” Bellafquih

name: Oozemat Coat
notes: Woven from an oozed-based, biosynthetic polymer, this practical garment is the number one choice for field researchers and lab workers alike. It provides the high adaptability and resilience necessary to protect its wearer from any unfortunate accidents that may occur during the noble pursuit of sci

name: Slime-In-A-Skull
notes: Within this humanoid skull resides a friendly ooze who wishes only to be helpful to the owner of its home. Joyful gurgling sounds can occasionally be heard emanating from the eye sockets and, very rarely, a curious eye will peek out of the mouth.

name: Ventilation Unit D-20
notes: Chaouki ‘’Ciao’” Titouhi & Michelle Mueller

name: Mawling Maul
notes: Burning with ravenous hunger and unquenchable hanger, this mimic-infused weapon struggles relentlessly against the sturdy iron chains that bind it. Loosening the chains stimulates the weapon’s digestive juices which, if not quenched, can have caustic consequences for its wielder.

name: Mimickey
notes: This bone and flesh keyring can be socketed on any weapon or held item. As an action, you can hold the item by the keyring and spin it in a circle, causing the socketed item to shrink to the size of a key. Using an action to spin it while key-sized returns it to its normal size.

name: Spelleater Tome
notes: Learning and developing new spells can be a tedious and time-consuming process. Luckily, the spelleater tome is a shortcut to becoming a spell-slinging savant. Originally a creation of Jonjo Starr, the tome has become a favourite among lazy wizarding apprentices the world over.

name: Haemstrike
notes: This weapon is naturally attracted to foes bearing ferrous metals, allowing it to strike them with more force. Those who align themselves more closely with the weapon are granted the ability to manipulate gravity, telekinetically pulling creatures and objects into range of its jagged-faced swings.

name: Magnetite Horn
notes: Mohammed “Aggi” Bellafquih

name: Shard Crown
notes: From the horn and eyes of a magnetite dragon is crafted this crown of magnetite. The creature’s commanding presence and power over the blood of others allow the wearer of this object to bend its foes to its will.

name: Snow Wolf Cowl
notes: Few warriors can claim to have single-handedly bested a full-grown snow wolf. Those that do can have the head of such a monster enchanted by a clan shaman, granting them the power to transform into the beast. Such cowls are prized trophies amongst the frozen Norse clans, symbols of might and status.

name: Broodmother’s Embrace
notes: Mohammed “Aggi” Bellafquih

name: Broodmother’s Eye
notes: While socketed in an item, the item gains the Intense Stare property.

name: Broodslinger
notes: Known fondly by L’Arsène as Ling’s Bane, this forearm-mounted symbiote represents the conquering of the incredibly infectious broodmother strain of aboleths. This blind broodling has been altered to feed off of its host’s nutrients, generating powerfully acidic mucous. A small note attached to one t

name: Tome of Living Memories
notes: The pages of this book are littered with the shifting memories of all the aboleth broodmother’s eyes have seen. name: Astral Luggage
notes: Mohammed “Aggi” Bellafquih

name: Dreamy the Lucid
notes: Chaouki‘’Ciao’” Titouhi

name: Hammer Time
notes: Never has the saying “smash something into next week” been so apt. With an hourglass filled with brilliant platinum sand, this magical impact weapon utilises the dreamholder’s command over time dilation to throw its victims forward in time.

name: Robes of Beaurêve
notes: Michelle Mueller

name: Second Chance
notes: Michelle Mueller

name: Time Splitter
notes: The time splitter is just the tool for an almighty adventurer who’s always a little too slow to get where they need to be exactly in the nick of time. Harnessing the time dilative power of the dreamholder, this magic weapon lets its wielder swing back in time, or speed the flow of time for itself, a

name: Eyes of Googly
notes: Firm, and always slightly moist to the touch, this pair of eyes wanders of their own accord. When placed on a single object that can fit inside a 5-foot cube, the object becomes sentient. It can’t speak, and has statistics the GM deems appropriate.

name: Grill of Barbecuing
notes: Michelle Mueller

name: Heliana’s Guide to Monster Hunting
notes: Full of useful knowledge and heavy enough to crush a skull, Heliana’s Guide to Monster Hunting is nothing if not handy. The personalised quotes from Heliana, Peeper’s deft proofing and editing, and the numerous ink stains and spilled watercolours give this hefty tome a homemade feel.

name: L’Arsène’s Quadnoculars
notes: Expecting a flood of adventurers to buy Heliana’s book and begin crafting their own magic items —potentially putting him out of a job!—L’Arsène devised a way he might profit from the book’s popularity. With a series of articulating lenses that filter out threads belonging to different schools of mag

name: Tinytar
notes: With the sentient tar of a tar elemental and a dose of enchantment magic, one can craft this friendly and amenable little helper. When applied to anything you can hold, the tinytar ensures you don’t accidentally drop it.

name: Acheron Blade
notes: The black blade of this sword is crafted from a mysterious arcane alloy. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. While the sword is on your person, you are immune to effects that turn undead.

name: Amulet of the Drunkard
notes: This amulet smells of old, ale-stained wood. While wearing it, you can regain 4d4 + 4 hit points when you drink a pint of beer, ale, mead, or wine. Once the amulet has restored hit points, it can’t do so again until the next dawn.

name: Arcane Cannon
notes: This Large cannon is imbued with magic. It requires no ammunition and doesn’t need to be loaded. It takes one action to aim the cannon and one action to fire it. After the cannon has fired, it must recharge for 5 minutes before it can be fired again.

name: Battering Shield
notes: While holding this iron tower shield, you gain a +1 bonus to AC. This bonus is in addition to the shield’s normal bonus to AC.

name: Bloodaxe
notes: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic axe. The axe deals an extra 1d6 necrotic damage to creatures that aren’t constructs or undead. If you reduce such a creature to 0 hit points with an attack using this axe, you gain 10 temporary hit points.

name: Breathing Bubble
notes: This translucent, bubble-like sphere has a slightly tacky outer surface, and you gain the item’s benefits only while wearing it over your head like a helmet.

name: Brooch of Living Essence
notes: While wearing this nondescript brooch, spells and anything else that would detect or reveal your creature type treat you as humanoid, and those that would reveal your alignment treat it as neutral.

name: Butcher’s Bib
notes: This black leather apron is perpetually covered by blood, even after being washed off. You gain the following benefits while wearing the apron:

name: Coin of Delving
notes: This scintillating copper coin sheds dim light in a 5-foot radius. If dropped a distance greater than 5 feet, the coin issues a melodious ringing sound when it hits a surface. Any creature that can hear the chime can determine the distance the coin dropped based on the tone.

name: Corpse Slayer
notes: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Dispelling Stone
notes: This smooth, rainbow-colored, egg-shaped stone can be thrown up to 30 feet and explodes in a 10-foot-radius sphere of magical energy on impact, destroying the stone. Any active spell of 5th level or lower in the sphere ends.

name: Duskcrusher
notes: This item takes the form of a leather-wrapped metal rod emblazoned with the symbol of Pelor, the Dawn Father. While grasping the rod, you can use a bonus action to cause a warhammer head of crackling radiance to spring into existence. The warhammer’s radiant head emits bright light in a 15-foot radi

name: Dust of Deliciousness
notes: This reddish brown dust can be sprinkled over any edible substance to greatly improve the flavor. The dust also dulls the eater’s senses: anyone eating food treated with this dust has disadvantage on Wisdom ability checks and Wisdom saving throws for 1 hour. There is enough dust to flavor six servin

name: Goggles of Object Reading
notes: These leather-framed goggles feature purple crystal lenses. While wearing the goggles, you have advantage on Intelligence (Arcana) checks made to reveal information about a creature or object you can see.

name: Hunter’s Coat
notes: You gain a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor.

name: Last Stand Armor
notes: You have a +1 bonus to AC while wearing this armor, which shimmers softly.

name: Luxon Beacon
notes: This dodecahedron of faintly glowing crystal is heavier than it appears. A set of handles are affixed to its sides, and it pulsates and thrums when touched.

name: Needle of Mending
notes: This weapon is a magic dagger disguised as a sewing needle. When you hold it and use a bonus action to speak its command word, it transforms into a dagger or back into a needle.

name: Nightfall Pearl
notes: Used to summon night, this 6-inch-diameter, jet-black orb is cold to the touch. You can spend 10 minutes to activate it, causing the area within 10 miles of it at the moment of activation to become night even if it is daytime. This night lasts for 24 hours, until you cancel it as an action, or until

name: Orb of the Veil
notes: This onyx sphere bears deep, spiraling grooves and dangles from an iron chain. While the orb is on your person, you gain the following benefits:

name: Potion of Maximum Power
notes: The first time you cast a damage-dealing spell of 4th level or lower within 1 minute after drinking the potion, instead of rolling dice to determine the damage dealt, you can instead use the highest number possible for each die.

name: Potion of Possibility
notes: When you drink this clear potion, you gain two Fragments of Possibility, each of which looks like a Tiny, grayish bead of energy that follows you around, staying within 1 foot of you at all times. Each fragment lasts for 8 hours or until used.

name: Reincarnation Dust
notes: When this small pouch of purple dust is sprinkled on a dead humanoid or a piece of a dead humanoid, the dust is absorbed by the remains. If willing, the dead creature returns to life with a new body as if the reincarnate spell had been cast on the remains.

name: Ring of Obscuring
notes: This band of iron resembles a skull and is cold to the touch. It has 3 charges and regains 1d3 expended charges daily at dawn. As an action while wearing the ring, you can expend 1 of its charges to cast the fog cloud spell from it, with the following changes: the cloud is centered on you when it fi

name: Ring of Temporal Salvation
notes: If you die while wearing this gray crystal ring, you vanish and reappear in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the space you left (or the nearest unoccupied space). You have a number of hit points equal to 3d6 + your Constitution modifier. If your hit point maximum is lower than the number of hit

name: Rod of Retribution
notes: This adamantine rod is tipped with a glowing crystalline eye. The rod has 3 charges and regains all its expended charges daily at dawn.

name: Spell Bottle
notes: This glass bottle can store one spell of up to 5th level at a time. When found, roll a d6 and subtract 1; the total determines the level of spell in the bottle (the DM chooses the spell, and 0 means the bottle is empty). A swirling blue vapor fills the bottle while it contains a spell.

name: Staff of Dunamancy
notes: This staff of polished gray wood bears numerous runes carved along its length. The staff has 10 charges and regains 1d6 + 4 expended charges daily at dawn. If you expend the last charge, roll a d20. On a 1, the staff turns into dust and is destroyed.

name: Staff of the Ivory Claw
notes: This gray-and-cerulean staff is topped with a small dragon claw carved from ivory. While holding the staff, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls. Whenever you score a critical hit with a spell attack, the target takes an extra 3d6 radiant damage.

name: Vox Seeker
notes: This clockwork device resembles a metal crab the size of a dinner plate. Every action used to wind up the device allows it to operate for 1 minute, to a maximum of 10 minutes. While operational, the item uses the accompanying vox seeker stat block. This automaton is under the DM’s control. A vox see

name: Weapon of Certain Death
notes: When you damage a creature with an attack using this magic weapon, the target can’t regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

name: Danoth’s Visor
notes: These mithral-frame goggles with clear diamond lenses were used by the evoker Danoth Oro to spot invisible enemies and scout areas from afar.

name: Grimoire Infinitus
notes: Several of these spellbooks with gilded pages and silver-plated covers were created during the Age of Arcanum, but only one has been found since the Calamity ended. The book has an infinite number of pages, is three inches thick, eight inches wide, twelve inches long, and weighs three pounds.

name: Hide of the Feral Guardian
notes: It is believed that this polished and beautifully detailed leather armor was a gift from Melora, bestowed on a long-forgotten archdruid and champion of the natural world before the terrors of the Calamity.

name: Infiltrator’s Key
notes: This mithral skeleton key was forged using the blood of twelve master thieves executed for trying to steal magic items during the Age of Arcanum.

name: Stormgirdle
notes: A stormgirdle is a wide belt made of thick leather branded with the symbol of Kord. The girdle’s clasps are made from dragon ivory.

name: Verminshroud
notes: This patchy cloak was pieced together from the pelts of rats found feasting on the dead in Blightshore and is dotted with the bloated corpses of magically preserved insects along its seams.

name: Wreath of the Prism
notes: This loop of golden thorns is inset with dozens of gems representing the five colors of Tiamat.

name: Blade of Broken Mirrors
notes: A weapon of Tharizdun, this dagger is a piece of jagged stone whose blade is scribed with a maze-like pattern with no beginning or end.

name: Grovelthrash
notes: Crafted from a single piece of obsidian, this warhammer of Torog hums with magical energy and is carved with the images of faces screaming in pain.

name: Lash of Shadows
notes: This snakeskin whip is touched by the power of Zehir and ends in five animated serpent heads.

name: Mace of the Black Crown
notes: This mace has a haft of black iron and a ruby head with a fiendish countenance. Carrying the boon of Asmodeus, it is fit for the most powerful servants of the Nine Hells.

name: Ruin’s Wake
notes: This spear is made from the ivory bone of an ancient gold dragon and carved with an Orc hymn to Gruumsh.

name: Silken Spite
notes: The blade of this rapier is made of spider silk. Its onyx pommel is tipped with a ruby cut in the shape of a spider, and the blade carries the blessing of Lolth.

name: The Bloody End
notes: Carrying the power of Bane, this adamantine morningstar sports foot-long spikes and has a jagged blade on its pommel.

name: Will of the Talon
notes: Black, blue, green, red, and white gems carved in the form of dragon heads cover this ostentatious gold war pick, marking it as a weapon channeling the power of Tiamat.

name: Abracadabrus
notes: An abracadabrus is an ornate, gemstone-studded wooden chest that weighs 25 pounds while empty. Its interior compartment is a cube measuring 1½ feet on a side.

name: Cauldron of Plenty
notes: This cauldron is made of thick copper that has turned green with age. It is 4 feet wide, has a mouth 3½ feet in diameter, weighs 50 pounds, and can hold up to 30 gallons of liquid. Embossed on its bulging sides are images of satyrs and nymphs in repose, holding ladles. The cauldron comes with a lid

name: Hook of Fisher’s Delight
notes: This tiny silver fishhook has a little gold feather attached to it. For it to function, the feathered hook must be tied to the end of a fishing line and immersed in enough water to fill at least a 10-foot cube. At the end of each uninterrupted hour of immersion, roll a d6. On a 6, a floppy, 6-inch-l

name: Lantern of Tracking
notes: This hooded lantern burns for 6 hours on 1 pint of oil, shedding bright light in a 30-foot radius and dim light for an additional 30 feet.

name: Professor Orb
notes: A professor orb is a smooth 5-pound sphere of smoky gray quartz about the size of a grapefruit. Close examination reveals two or more pinpricks of silver light coming from deep inside the sphere.

name: Scroll of Tarrasque Summoning
notes: Using an action to read the scroll causes the tarrasque (see the creature’s entry in the Monster Manual) to appear in an unoccupied space you can see within 1 mile of you. The tarrasque disappears when it drops to 0 hit points and is hostile toward all creatures other than itself.

name: Scroll of the Comet
notes: By using an action to read the scroll, you cause a comet to fall from the sky and crash to the ground at a point you can see up to 1 mile away from you. You must be outdoors when you use the scroll, or nothing happens and the scroll is wasted.

name: Thermal Cube
notes: This 3-inch cube of solid brimstone generates enough dry heat to keep the temperature within 15 feet of it at 95 degrees Fahrenheit (35 degrees Celsius).

name: Ythryn Mythallar
notes: A mythallar looks like an enormous crystal ball held in an ornate cradle. The globe sheds bright light in a 300-foot radius and dim light for an additional 300 feet. The globe draws magic from the Weave that can be harnessed for various purposes. For example, Netherese mages used mythallars to keep

name: Charm of Plant Command
notes: This fist-sized charm is made from a bundle of dried plant stems wrapped in silver thread. Hung on a leather thong, it is typically worn around the neck or attached to a belt.

name: Cursed Luckstone
notes: This flat, gray-and-black river stone is inscribed with an unknown arcane symbol and feels cool to the touch. While carrying the stone, you can gain advantage on one ability check of your choice. The stone can’t be used this way again until the next dawn.

name: Helm of Underwater Action
notes: While wearing this brass helmet, you can breathe underwater, you gain darkvision with a range of 60 feet, and you gain a swimming speed of 30 feet.

name: Pipe of Remembrance
notes: This long, delicate wooden pipe features a bowl made from smooth river stone. When the pipe is lit, smoke exhaled from it does not dissipate, instead lingering around the bearer. After 10 minutes, the smoke forms moving shapes that reenact the bearer’s most impressive and heroic achievements for 5 m

name: Pressure Capsule
notes: This small capsule is made of beeswax blended with sand and a variety of enchanted water plants. A creature who consumes a pressure capsule ignores the effects of swimming at depths greater than 100 feet (see “Unusual Environments” in chapter 5 of the Dungeon Master’s Guide).

name: Sekolahian Worshiping Statuette
notes: Skillfully carved from sandstone, this 1-foot-tall statuette depicts a shark twisting through the water with its mouth open. If any Tiny sea-dwelling animal is within 1 inch of the statuette’s mouth, the shark flashes to life and deals 1 piercing damage to it. The shark can deal damage in this way n

name: Adze of Annam
notes: Isabel Gibney

name: Armor of Safeguarding
notes: Set in the center of this armor’s chest is a citrine engraved with the shield rune.

name: Bigby’s Beneficent Bracelet
notes: Isabel Gibney

name: Bloodshed Blade
notes: The hilt of this sword bears a carnelian engraved with the blood rune.

name: Crown of the Wrath Bringer
notes: This jagged iron circlet bears ornaments in the shape of the enemy rune. When worn, the crown glows with pale light as it draws upon the wearer’s fury to strike opponents with vicious terror.

name: Delver’s Claws
notes: The back of this weatherworn leather glove is adorned with three large metal hooks shaped like a mole’s claws. Stitched into the glove’s palm is the mountain rune.

name: Glowrune Pigment
notes: This set of 1d4 + 2 small paint pots contains pigments mixed from crushed luminescent gemstones. This magical paint bestows temporary magical gifts on creatures with runes drawn on their skin with this paint.

name: Harp of Gilded Plenty
notes: This golden harp is sculpted in the image of the god Iallanis, depicted as a young cloud giant woman. When a creature comes within 5 feet of the harp, the instrument animates and is capable of speaking, singing, and playing by itself.

name: Helm of Perfect Potential
notes: This copper-hued helm contains a shard of the Elemental Chaos embedded in its forehead, surrounded by a motif of a rising sun. Legend says Annam fashioned this helm for his daughter Diancastra to hold the fragment of chaos she used to prove her worth to her father.

name: Lash of Immolation
notes: The handle of this dark leather whip bears the fire rune, and embers dance around the whip’s tail.

name: Longbow of the Healing Hearth
notes: This ivory longbow is inscribed with a prayer to the god Hiatea, the runes of which are entwined with gilded engravings of wheat stalks and deer antlers.

name: Lucent Destroyer
notes: This magic weapon is a triple-barreled bronze musket. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. It requires no ammunition, its damage is radiant instead of piercing, and it doesn’t have the loading property. The base of the weapon is emblazoned with the light rune.

name: Mistral Mantle
notes: This thick, fur-lined cloak has the frost rune stitched on the hem in silvery blue thread. Frigid wind swirls around the cloak, regardless of the weather.

name: Nimbus Coronet
notes: The design of this bronze circlet resembles swirling clouds. At its center is set a deep-blue stone, upon which is inscribed the cloud rune.

name: Orb of Skoraeus
notes: Said to be infused with the wisdom and power of the god Skoraeus, this polished stone orb is veined with iridescent crystal that seems to glow from within. The orb is 8 inches in diameter and weighs 8 pounds, making it a palm-sized trinket for a stone giant but a more unwieldy item for a Medium crea

name: Reaper’s Scream
notes: The spikes of this iron morningstar glow with sickly, pale light. The death rune is inscribed on its shaft and inlaid with pearl.

name: Ring of Amity
notes: This ring is carved from hematite and bears an engraving of the friend rune.

name: Sanctum Amulet
notes: A black opal pendant hangs at the base of this pearlescent chain. The sacred rune is inscribed on the back of the pendant.

name: Shield of the Blazing Dreadnought
notes: Modeled after the formidable spiked tower shields wielded by some fire giants, this iron shield emanates a constant warmth.

name: Staff of the Rooted Hills
notes: The hill rune is carved into this gnarled wooden staff. The staff magically resizes to match the height of any creature that attunes to it.

name: Stonebreaker’s Breastplate
notes: This breastplate is made from marbled granite, though it feels no heavier than a typical metal breastplate. Its chest is emblazoned with the stone rune.

name: Thunderbuss
notes: Isabel Gibney

name: War Horn of Valor
notes: This brass war horn is engraved with the war rune, which glows purple when the horn is blown.

name: Wayfarer’s Boots
notes: This pair of boots is made of durable cloth, with the journey rune stitched in golden thread above each heel. While you are wearing this item, your walking speed increases by 10 feet, and you have advantage on Wisdom (Survival) checks.

name: Wyrmreaver Gauntlets
notes: Originally crafted for ground-bound giant brawlers to fight against dragons and other enormous predators of the sky, these studded gauntlets are engraved with the dragon rune.

name: Zephyr Armor
notes: This fine set of white-and-silver armor bears the wind rune upon its chest.

name: Baleful Talon
notes: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this hooked, obsidian dagger.

name: Breastplate of Balance
notes: This burnished copper breastplate looks as if it were made of interlocking gears. Merchant’s scales are emblazoned across the chest.

name: Crown of Whirling Comets
notes: Wade Acuff

name: Donjon’s Sundering Sphere
notes: This marble-size crystal sphere glows with extraplanar energy.

name: Euryale’s Aegis
notes: Axel Defois

name: Fabulist Gem
notes: This glittering red gem is commonly found embedded in a ring or brooch.

name: Fool’s Blade
notes: This weapon appears ordinary, but it bears strong illusion magic that allows its wielder to skillfully deceive opponents.

name: Glimmering Moonbow
notes: This silver-and-black bow is engraved with the phases of the moon. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Jester’s Mask
notes: This colorful, harlequin domino mask is edged with pearls. While wearing this mask, you gain the following benefits:

name: Plate of Knight’s Fellowship
notes: This gleaming set of silver-and-gold plate armor never tarnishes.

name: Ring of Puzzler’s Wit
notes: This gold ring bears a fluorite stone and is enchanted to sharpen the wearer’s mind.

name: Rod of Hellish Flames
notes: Glowing cinders orbit the flanged head of this black iron rod.

name: Rogue’s Mantle
notes: This dark, hooded mantle of thick cloth is infused with secretive and deceptive magic. While wearing it, you gain the following benefits:

name: Ruinous Flail
notes: This ash-gray flail is cold to the touch. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon, and it deals double damage to objects and structures.

name: Skull Helm
notes: While wearing this skull-shaped helm, you have resistance to cold, poison, and necrotic damage.

name: Spindle of Fate
notes: Axel Defois

name: Starshot Crossbow
notes: This crossbow is crafted from blackened wood, and its limbs bear pearl inlays depicting constellations. You ignore the loading property with this crossbow. If you load no ammunition in the weapon, it produces its own, automatically creating one piece of magic ammunition when you make a ranged attack

name: Sun Staff
notes: Veins of sunstone run through this wooden staff. This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it. When you hit with an attack roll using this staff, the target takes an extra 1d8 fire damage.

name: Voidwalker Armor
notes: This black studded leather armor bears a red sheen. While wearing this armor, you can use a bonus action to summon a projection of yourself in an unoccupied space within 30 feet of yourself. The projection is a translucent copy of you that has immunity to all damage and conditions, and you can make

name: Warrior’s Passkey
notes: This silver skeleton key is warm to the touch. While holding the key in its key form, you can use an action to cast the Knock spell from the key.

name: Weapon of Throne’s Command
notes: This weapon is bedecked in ornate gold filigree and deep-blue and maroon jewels. You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this weapon. Additionally, you gain proficiency in the Intimidation and Persuasion skills if you don’t already have it.

name: Alluring Dye
notes: This dye is available in many different colors, from the brightest of hues seen on bright gallus to more subtle brown, black, and green shades. Applying this thick paste to your feathers, fur, or hair permanently dyes it the color of the dye. You gain +2 to Charisma saving throws for 24 hours after

name: Antlers of the True Path
notes: This polished wooden divining rod is a highly valued tool among Cairith’s seers. It is carved into the shape of antlers and scored with delicate filigree.

name: Band of Fruitfulness
notes: This gold bangle is etched with depictions of fruits, vegetables, and prepared foods. It has 6 charges. You can speak the command word and expend up to 6 charges to cause the bangle to fly from your wrist and transform into a gold table filled with fresh and lovingly made home-cooked dishes. This fo

name: Basilisk Crystal
notes: Such crystals are grown on the backs of basilisks before they are shed, and possess incredible hardness. A basilisk crystal cannot be effectively cut or damaged except by tools or weapons made of adamantine.

name: Belt of the Weald
notes: This thin chain belt appears to be made of metal, yet closer inspection reveals it to be made up of links of highly polished wood. While wearing this belt, you gain the following benefits:

name: Chronicle of Fools
notes: A poorly bound leather journal, the chronicle of fools is filled with stories from countless adventurers and chroniclers, spanning centuries. The back of the book perpetually has blank pages that hunger for more stories. The cover is indestructible, and if the pages are damaged or removed, they will

name: Cloak of Spines
notes: This garment is made of large, soft quills that harden while worn. When wearing this cloak, your AC becomes 14 + your Dexterity modifier if you aren’t wearing any armor.

name: Cogwork Wings
notes: These wings are a strange device made by a mapach tinkerer. Two wings, made of brass and cloth, are attached to a box containing an intricate array of gears and cogs. Leather straps allow it to be worn on the back. It has two levers, one on either side of the central mechanism. Before donning the wi

name: Cream of Ooze Moisturizing Face Serum
notes: When you apply this light pink cream, it causes a prestidigitation-like effect, cleaning any grime or dirt from your face or another equivalent-sized area of your body you apply it to.

name: Crown of Daffodils
notes: This enchanted flower crown is woven from leafy, flowering vines which sprout 1d4 blooming daffodils. As long as the crown has at least one daffodil in bloom while you wear it, you gain a +1 bonus to ability checks and saving throws.

name: Draught of Feather Shine
notes: When you consume this oily draught, you gain advantage on Charisma ability checks and saving throws for 24 hours. If you have feathers, they are noticeably more shiny than usual.

name: Draught of Slime Curse Cure
notes: This slightly astringent green liquid is thick and viscous, and is filled with bubbles. Drinking this potion grants you the benefits of the remove curse spell as though it were cast on you, as well as advantage on saving throws made to resist being cursed for 1 hour after you drink it.

name: Egg of Rebirth
notes: This smooth golden egg fits in your hand. It feels warm and is surprisingly strong despite its delicate appearance. It is blessed with the life-giving powers of Ardea. Attuning to the egg involves placing a portion of your life energy inside of it. You can feel your life force within it, and once yo

name: Eye of Starsight
notes: This black bronze amulet is made of intricate cogwork and has a single polished glass orb the size of an eye set tightly in its center. This item has 3 charges and regains 1d3 charges each night at dusk.

name: Fangs of Guile
notes: This rare necklace was created by supplicants of Kren, who obtained knowledge of their craft in a ritual exchange. The necklace imbues its wearer with equal parts guile and ferocity.

name: Feather Robe
notes: This luxuriant robe is made from the feather of a birdfolk spellcaster. Though it appears to be made of many individual plumes, the robe is actually composed of only a single feather, flawlessly copied over and over again by the magic that created it.

name: Flame of Ingenuity
notes: This wooden lantern contains a small flame within and represents the true power of fire’s gift when properly harnessed. The creation of the first flame of ingenuity is said to have been divinely inspired by Gesme herself.

name: Glowing Ember
notes: This clear crystal contains an ember suspended in its center. It weighs one pound and feels perpetually warm to the touch.

name: Kwark’s Wondrous Kernels
notes: These 1-inch-diameter kernels, which come in various shapes and colors, are found in ordinary-looking velvet pouches containing 2d4 seeds. The kernels come in two varieties, planters and tossables. For each bag found, the GM rolls a d8 to determine what types of kernels the bag holds, or chooses ker

name: Marotte of Chance
notes: This flashy bird-shaped jester’s baton has been imbued with the magic of the Amaranthine Clhuran: the magic of fate. Lumas can tap into this force to unleash all manner of magical effects.

name: Pathfinder’s Pebble
notes: This polished pebble is inscribed with the holy symbol of Reya and carries a powerful blessing from the Amaranthine. So long as you carry the pebble and are outdoors, you always know which way is north.

name: Potion of Rest
notes: This pale blue elixir has a jasmine flower suspended within it. It is brewed using bluebee venom, which helps the imbiber sleep calmly and deeply.

name: Recall Crystal
notes: As an action, you can smash this small clear crystal to teleport yourself and any equipment you are wearing or holding back to the Alderheart council chambers.

name: Red-Feather Bow
notes: A prized hunting weapon among mistral raptors, this bow is imbued with magic to help the wielder see their prey from afar.

name: Ring of Plant Speech
notes: While wearing this ring, you can speak with plants and plant creatures within 30 feet of you as though you share a common language. Non-sentient plants within 30 feet of you gain sentience and can communicate with you telepathically, and you can question them about events they have witnessed within

name: Ring of the Sky Hunter
notes: The dark metal talons of this ring’s setting grasp a blue gem that seems to swirl with patterns of windswept clouds. This ring has 3 charges, and it regains 1d3 spent charges each day at dawn.

name: Saber of Unity
notes: This sword has been imbued with the spirit of Gaspard’s leadership and grants whoever wields it a portion of his courage. You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic sword. In addition, you and any allies within 10 feet of you are immune to being frightened while you wield it

name: Shroud of Ending
notes: There is an old tale about a foolish birdfolk sage who believed themselves to be even wiser than the Amaranthine. One day, while wandering alone in the Wood at night, they met Tyton, who had come to collect their soul. Rather than accept their death with dignity, the sage instead debated with Tyton

name: Slimeforged Blade
notes: You have a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

name: Staff of Climbing Ivy
notes: This staff is formed from several strands of leafy vines that have grown together into the shape of a twisted walking stick. It is rigid and sturdy.

name: Talons of the Squall
notes: Awarded to those who pass the test of endurance administered by priests of Altus, these leg-bracers seem to crackle with faint energy. While you wear them, you gain the following benefits:

name: Talon Tincture
notes: When you apply this light tincture to your talons, claws, or other appendages, you gain advantage on Dexterity ability checks and saving throws for 24 hours.

name: The Thorn of Kren
notes: A pitch black thorn that thrums with eldritch power. When you touch the thorn, you must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or become automatically attuned to the thorn. If becoming attuned to this item causes you to go over your maximum number of attuned items, the GM chooses one of your current

name: Whistle of Freedom
notes: This captain’s whistle has magical properties that, when blown, grants all creatures that can hear the whistle and are within 100 feet advantage on their next saving throw against a spell or effect currently affecting them. Any creature who can hear the whistle and is under a mind-controlling effect

name: Banner of the Krig Rune
notes: Crafted from a thick, red fabric, this banner measures 5 feet high and 3 feet wide. The krig (war) rune is displayed on the fabric with round, metal plates sewn into it. It can be attached to a 10-foot pole to serve as a standard. Furling or unfurling the banner requires an action. The banner has th

name: Blod Stone
notes: This diamond contains the blood of a creature—blood that appears in the form of the blod (blood) rune. While the item is on your person, you can use your action to divine the location of the creature nearest to you that is related to the blood in the item and that isn’t Undead. You sense the distanc

name: Claw of the Wyrm Rune
notes: This dragon’s claw has been covered with a coat of molten silver, upon which has been inscribed the wyrm (dragon) rune. The claw has the following properties.

name: Conch of Teleportation
notes: This item is an ordinary, albeit rather large, conch shell that has been inscribed with the uvar rune. The conch measures 2½ feet long and weighs 20 pounds.

name: Gavel of the Venn Rune
notes: This wooden gavel is small by giant reckoning but nearly the size of a warhammer in human hands. The venn (friend) rune is inscribed in mithral in the base of the haft. Among giants, this item is used as part of rituals to resolve disputes. The gavel has the following properties.

name: Gurt’s Greataxe
notes: In the Year of the Icy Axe (123 DR), the frost giant lord Gurt fell to Uthgar Gardolfsson—leader of the folk who would become the Uthgardt—in a battle that marked the ascendance of humankind over the giants in the Dessarin Valley. Gurt’s greataxe was buried in Morgur’s Mound until it was unearthed a

name: Ingot of the Skold Rune
notes: This appears to be a simple ingot of iron ore, about a foot long and a few inches across. Inspection of its surface reveals the faint, silvery outline of the skold (shield) rune. The ingot has the following properties, which work only while it’s on your person.

name: Korolnor Scepter
notes: The Korolnor Scepter is one of ten Ruling Scepters of Shanatar, forged by the dwarven gods and given to the ruling houses of the ancient dwarven empire. The Korolnor Scepter’s location was unknown for the longest time until a storm giant queen, Neri, found it in a barnacle-covered shipwreck at the b

name: Navigation Orb
notes: A navigation orb is a hollow, 7-foot-diameter sphere of thin, polished mithral with a large skye (cloud) rune embossed on its outer surface. The orb levitates 10 feet above the ground and is keyed to a particular cloud castle, allowing you to control that castle’s altitude and movement while the orb

name: Opal of the Ild Rune
notes: This triangular fire opal measures about three inches on each side and is half an inch thick. The ild (fire) rune shimmers within its core, causing it to be slightly warm to the touch. The opal has the following properties, which work only while it’s on your person.

name: Orb of the Stein Rune
notes: This orb of granite is about the size of an adult human’s fist. The stein (stone) rune appears on it in the form of crystalline veins that run across the surface. The orb has the following properties, which work only while it’s on your person.

name: Pennant of the Vind Rune
notes: This blue pennant is crafted from silk and is five feet long and whips about as if buffeted by a wind. The vind (wind) rune appears on its surface, looking almost like a cloud. The pennant has the following properties, which work only while it’s on your person.

name: Gift of Wind. You Can Transfer the Pennant’s Magic to a Nonmagical Item—a Suit of Armor, a Pair of Boots, or a Cloak—by Tracing the Vind Rune There with Your Finger. the Transfer Takes 8 Hours of Work That Requires the Two Items to Be Within 5 Feet of Each Other. at the End, the Pennant Is Destroyed, and the Rune Appears in Silver on the Chosen Item, Which Gains a Benefit Based on Its Form:
notes: Boots/Cloak. The pair of boots or cloak is now a rare magic item that requires attunement. While wearing the item, you can convert up to 20 feet of your movement on each of your turns into flight. If you don’t land at the end of this flight, you fall unless you have another means of staying aloft. Y

name: Potion of Giant Size
notes: When you drink this potion, you become Huge for 24 hours if you are Medium or smaller, otherwise the potion does nothing. For that duration, your Strength becomes 25, if it isn’t already higher, and your hit point maximum is doubled (your current hit points are doubled when you drink the potion). In

name: Robe of Serpents
notes: A robe of serpents is a stylish silk garment that is popular among wealthy nobles and retired assassins. The robe is emblazoned with 1d4 + 3 stylized serpents, all brightly colored.

name: Rod of the Vonindod
notes: The fire giant duke Zalto hired a wizard to craft several of these adamantine rods. Each measures 4 feet long, weighs 100 pounds, and is sized to fit comfortably in a fire giant’s hand. The rod has two prongs at one end and a molded handle grip on the opposite end.

name: Shard of the Ise Rune
notes: This shard of ice is long and slender, roughly the size of a dagger. The ise (ice) rune glows within it. The shard has the following properties, which work only while it’s on your person.

name: Battle Standard of Infernal Power
notes: This hell-forged battle standard is made of infernal iron and fitted with a small, unopenable cage containing a quasit. The trapped quasit is incapacitated, and its cage has AC 19, 10 hit points, and immunity to all types of damage except force damage. If killed or somehow released, the quasit disap

name: Gauntlets of Flaming Fury
notes: While you wear both of these steel gauntlets, any non-magical weapon you grasp with either gauntlet is treated as a magic weapon. As a bonus action, you can use the gauntlets to cause magical flames to envelop one or two melee weapons in your grasp. Each flaming weapon deals an extra 1d6 fire damage

name: Fane-Eater
notes: Fane-Eater is a battleaxe belonging to Arkhan the Cruel.

name: Hellfire Weapon
notes: This weapon is fashioned from infernal iron and traced with veins of hellfire that shed dim light in a 5-foot-radius.

name: Helm of Devil Command
notes: Helm of Devil Command

name: Infernal Puzzle Box
notes: An infernal puzzle box is a cube-shaped container 5 to 6 inches on a side, composed of airtight, interlocking parts made from materials found in the Nine Hells. Most of these boxes are made of infernal iron, though some are carved from bone or horn. Infernal puzzle boxes are used to safeguard diabol

name: Infernal Tack
notes: A narzugon devil binds a nightmare (described in the Monster Manual) to its service with infernal tack, which consists of a bridle, bit, reins, saddle, stirrups, and spurs. A nightmare equipped with infernal tack must serve whoever wears the spurs until the wearer dies or the tack is removed.

name: Matalotok, the Frost Father
notes: Matalotok, the Frost Father, is an ancient hammer fashioned by Thrym, the god of frost giants. The favored weapon of the demon lord Kostchtchie, Matalotok is frigid to the touch and wreathed in mist.

name: Obsidian Flint Dragon Plate
notes: You gain a +2 bonus to AC and resistance to poison damage while you wear this armor. In addition, you gain advantage on ability checks and saving throws made to avoid or end the grappled condition on yourself.

name: Shield of the Hidden Lord
notes: The Shield of the Hidden Lord is of celestial origin and serves as a prison for the pit fiend Gargauth, whose mortal followers revere it as a god. Over time, Gargauth’s evil has warped the shield’s appearance, so that its celestial motif and designs have become twisted into a fiendish face that subt

name: Soul Coin
notes: Soul coins are about 5 inches across and about an inch thick, minted from infernal iron. Each coin weighs one-third of a pound, and is inscribed with Infernal writing and a spell that magically binds a single soul to the coin. Because each soul coin has a unique soul trapped within it, each has a st

name: Sword of Zariel
notes: Sword of Zariel

name: Bobbing Lily Pad
notes: This magic vehicle is a 10-foot-diameter leaf that floats on water. It has tendrils that propel it across land and across the water’s surface (but not underwater), as well as through the air. It has a walking, flying, and swimming speed of 20 feet, and it can hover. It moves according to your spoken

name: Chromatic Rose
notes: This magic rose comes in one of five colors, as noted in the Chromatic Roses table. While a rose is held, it gains a harmless visual effect as indicated on the table.

name: Dust of Corrosion

notes: As an action, you can sprinkle this dust on yourself or another creature you can see within 5 feet of you. The recipient gains a flying speed of 30 feet and the ability to hover for 1 minute. notes: When you drink this potion, you gain advantage on one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw of your choice that you make within the next hour.

notes: As an action, you make a few snips with these iron shears and cause the shadow of a Humanoid creature you can see within 5 feet of you to detach from its source. notes: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon.

notes: The Blackstaff is a sentient, rune-carved staff set with thin silver veins. It is the symbol of office for the Blackstaff, the highest-ranking wizard in Waterdeep. name: Bracer of Flying Daggers
notes: This armband appears to have thin daggers strapped to it. As an action, you can pull up to two magic daggers from the bracer and immediately hurl them, making a ranged attack with each dagger. A dagger vanishes if you don’t hurl it right away, and the daggers disappear right after they hit or miss.

name: Dragonstaff of Ahghairon
notes: While holding the dragonstaff of Ahghairon, you have advantage on saving throws against the spells and breath weapons of dragons, as well as the breath weapons of other creatures of the dragon type (such as dragon turtles).

name: Feather of Diatryma Summoning
notes: This bright plume is made from the feather of a diatryma (pronounced dee-ah-TRY-mah), a Large, colorful, flightless bird native to the Underdark. notes: While wearing this ring, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine whether someone is lying to you.

notes: Smokepowder is a magical explosive chiefly used to propel a bullet out of the barrel of a firearm. It is stored in airtight wooden kegs or tiny, waterproof leather packets. A packet contains enough smokepowder for five shots, and a keg holds enough smokepowder for five hundred shots.

name: Balloon Pack
notes: This backpack contains the spirit of an air elemental and a compact leather balloon. While wearing both claws, you gain a burrowing speed of 20 feet, and you can tunnel through solid rock at a rate of 1 foot per round.

notes: A devastation orb is an elemental bomb that can be created at the site of an elemental node by performing a ritual with an elemental weapon. The type of orb created depends on the node used. notes: This boomerang is a ranged weapon carved from griffon bone and etched with the symbol of elemental air. name: Windvane

notes: While you wear this adamantine crown, you have advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws, and you have resistance to psychic damage.

notes: This dark cloak is made of cured hell hound hide. As an action, you can command the cloak to transform you into a hell hound for up to 1 hour. The transformation otherwise functions as the polymorph spell, but you can use a bonus action to revert to your normal form.

notes: This stone is a large gem worth 150 gp.

notes: This elegant garment is made from fine cloth in hues of red, orange, and gold. While you wear the robe, you have resistance to cold damage. In addition, you are comfortable as if the temperature were that of a balmy day, so you suffer no ill effects from the weather’s temperature extremes.

name: Shatterspike
notes: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls you make with this magic weapon. If it hits an object, the hit is automatically a critical hit, and it can deal bludgeoning or slashing damage to the object (your choice). Further, damage from nonmagical sources can’t harm the weapon.

name: Spear of Backbiting
notes: You gain a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. When you throw it, its normal and long ranges both increase by 30 feet, and it deals one extra die of damage on a hit. After you throw it and it hits or misses, it flies back to your hand immediately.

name: Stone of Ill Luck
notes: This polished agate appears to be a stone of good luck to anyone who tries to identify it, and it confers that item’s property while on your person.

name: Wand of Entangle
notes: This wand has 7 charges. While holding it, you can use an action to expend 1 of its charges to cast the entangle spell (save DC 13) from it.

name: Waythe
notes: Waythe is a unique greatsword most recently in the possession of a high-ranking cloud giant ambassador.

name: Flying Chariot
notes: The chariot’s riders and creatures pulling the chariot gain a +1 bonus to their AC.

name: Helm of the Gods
notes: While wearing this helm, you know whether there is a celestial or fiend within 30 feet of you, as well as where the creature is located, provided the creature isn’t behind total cover.

name: Molten Bronze Skin
notes: This magical armor appears as a jug of molten bronze. When you attune to it, the bronze adheres and contours to your skin. The armor can be worn under normal clothes, but it doesn’t impede bodily functions. Once you put it on, it can’t be removed unless you choose to do so.

name: Potion of Aqueous Form
notes: When you drink this potion, you transform into a pool of water. You return to your true form after 10 minutes or if you are incapacitated or die.

notes: A creature that touches this ornate wooden vessel for 1 minute gains the benefits of a short rest. That creature also gains the effects of the bless spell until the creature finishes a short or long rest. The creature can’t gain these benefits again until it finishes a long rest.

name: Siren Song Lyre
notes: You can use an action to play this lyre and cast one of the following spells from it: animal friendship, charm person, enthrall, suggestion. If the spell requires a saving throw, the spell save DC is 13.

name: Sling Bullets of Althemone
notes: The sling bullets come in a pouch, which contains 1d4 + 4 bullets. Roll on the Magic Sling Bullets table for each bullet to determine its magical property.

name: Ephixis, Bow of Nylea
notes: Nylea wields the shortbow Ephixis, the bow whose arrows herald the turning of the seasons. Nylea is quick to let her favored followers borrow her bow, particularly when they intend to use it to perform great deeds, put an end to foul creatures, or cast down the arrogant.

name: Khrusor, Spear of Heliod
notes: Heliod wields Khrusor, a spear blessed with the power of the sun. In his hands, it can be pitched from Nyx to any point on Theros. When Heliod lends his weapon to a mortal, it’s typically so they can perform some great work in his name or as a test of their worthiness.

name: Foresight Weapon
notes: This weapon’s haft is engraved with sigils of divination. You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with this magic weapon. name: Spear of Gael Wode
notes: This spear was awarded to Vairae in recognition of their accomplishments on the battlefield, but it now lies discarded in the High Mage’s vaults.

name: Lava Crucible
notes: This 1-foot-diameter bowl is made of scorched and polished red dragon scales and engraved with fiery red runes on its exterior. While you carry the crucible, you are immune to fire damage and can speak and understand Draconic and Ignan.

name: Xaantikorijek’s Looking Glass
notes: This handheld silver mirror is made from a portion of Xaantikorijek’s Glass Cavern, and the back shows his thoughtful visage. While you carry the mirror, you are resistant to lightning and thunder damage.

name: Sun Eater Staff
notes: This lengthy staff of black wood has veins of black opal and obsidian running through it, and it feels cool to the touch. This staff can be wielded as a magic quarterstaff that grants a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls made with it.

name: Draconic Visage
notes: This mask bears the visage of a fearsome white-scaled dragon. When you finish a long rest, you can change the color of the mask’s scales to another color on the Draconic Visage Color table.
